title: Intelsat 33e demise exposes vulnerabilities in the space domain
summary:
Intelsat 33e’s break-up in geostationary orbit highlights an emerging threat for the contested space domain, an executive at U.S.-based space-tracking company ExoAnalytic Solutions said Dec. 10 during the Spacepower Conference here.

title: Space Meets Sound: NASA Lands in 2024 Spotify Wrapped
summary: NASA’s audio storytelling reached new frontiers in 2024, with Spotify Wrapped revealing the agency’s podcasts as a favorite among listeners worldwide. In celebration of the milestone, NASA astronaut Nick Hague spoke with Spotify about what space sounded like this year. “Music is one of those things that connects us to the planet,” said Hague, in […]

title: NASA Astronauts O’Hara and Moghbeli Explore Earth Data
summary: On Dec. 4, 2024, NASA astronauts Loral O’Hara, left, and Jasmin Moghbeli spent a moment in part of the Earth Information Center, an immersive experience combining live NASA data sets with innovative data visualization and storytelling at NASA Headquarters in Washington. title: Looking Out for ‘Lookout Hill’
summary: At Pico Turquino, a bedrock mesa on the Jezero crater rim, the science and engineering teams planned proximity science on Percy’s 30th abrasion patch, Rio Chiquito. title: December 2024 Transformer of the Month: Jill Marlowe
summary: If Digital Transformation were a ship, the vessel for delivering on our missions and ensuring smooth passage into the future, our final Digital Transformer of 2024 would be the captain. title: Sarah Peacock Surveys Stellar Radiation to Hunt for Habitable Worlds
summary: Knowing whether or not a planet elsewhere in the galaxy could potentially be habitable requires knowing a lot about that planet’s sun. Sarah Peacock relies on computer models to assess stars’ radiation, which can have a major influence on whether or not one of these exoplanets has breathable atmosphere. title: Black Hole Jet Stumbles Into Something in the Dark
summary: Even matter ejected by black holes can run into objects in the dark. Using NASA’s Chandra X-ray Observatory, astronomers have found an unusual mark from a giant black hole’s powerful jet striking an unidentified object in its path. The discovery was made in a galaxy called Centaurus A (Cen A), located about 12 million light-years […]

title: 50 Years Ago: Launch of Helios 1 to Explore the Sun
summary: On Dec. 10, 1974, NASA launched Helios 1, the first of two spacecraft to make close observations of the Sun.
